data.title: Actors Who Died on January 31
data.meta_description: Famous deaths in film and TV for the 31st of January. Browse actors, actresses and directors that died on January 31.
data.text:
Rolf Wenkhaus, German actor (Spoiling the Game, S.A.-Mann Brand), dies when his plane is shot down during WWII at 24

Henri de Vries [Hendricus Van Walterop], Dutch actor (Cleopatra, White Cargo), dies at 84

Florence Bates, American actress (Kismet, I Remember Mama), dies at 65

Lowell Gilmore, American actor (The Picture of Dorian Gray, Living Christ Series), dies at 53

Elizabeth Patterson, American stage, silent and sound screen character actress (The Boy Friend; Intruder in the Dust; I Love Lucy - "Mrs. Trumbull"), dies of pneumonia at 91

Glenn Morris, American athlete (Olympic gold decathlon 1936) and actor (Tarzan's Revenge; Hold That Co-ed), dies of congestive heart failure at 61

1974 Roger Pryor, American actor (Lady by Choice, Belle of the Nineties, Identity Unknown), dies at 72

Samuel Goldwyn

Polish born Jewish-American film producer (The Best Years of Our Lives) and movie magnate, dies of natural causes at 91

Jiří Srnka, Czech classical and film score composer, dies at 74

Yves Allégret, French film director, dies at 79

Jack Douglas, English comedian (My Brother Was an Only Child), dies at 80

George Abbott, American theater producer and film director (Damn Yankees; The Pajama Game), dies at 107

Eve Lister, British film and television actress (No Limit, Hyde Park), dies at 84

Giant Baba [Shohei Baba], Japanese professional wrestler (All Japan Pro Wrestling), dies at 61

Ralph Manza, American actor (Banacek, Mama Malone, Newhart), dies of a heart attack at 78

Moira Shearer, Scottish actress (The Red Shoes) and ballerina, dies at 80

Lee Bergere, American actor (Star Trek, Soap, Dynasty), dies at 82

Nagesh, Indian comedian actor in Kollywood (b. 1933)

Michael Tolan, American actor (Nurses, Senator), dies at 85

Christopher Jones, American actor, dies from cancer at 72

Lizabeth Scott [Emma Matzo], American actress (Desert Fury, Dark City), dies of heart failure at 92

Terry Wogan, British broadcaster (Eurovision Song Contest, Blankety Blank), dies of cancer at 77

Anne Gillis [Alma Conner], American actress (Faline-Bambi, Adventures of Tom Sawyer, Little Men), dies at 90

Carleton Carpenter, American magician, stage and screen actor (Two Weeks With Love; Up Periscope), songwriter, and mystery novelist (Cat Got Your Tongue?), dies at 95
